keyMoments.title: Naguri's Debut
keyMoments.description: Naguri appears and rescues Ace, Sabo, and Luffy from a powerful bear by using Conqueror's Haki to intimidate it.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of an anime-original character who possesses Conqueror's Haki and has history with the Pirate King.
keyMoments.quote: You youngsters shouldn't be messing with beasts you can't handle.

keyMoments.title: Naguri Uses Conqueror's Haki
keyMoments.description: Naguri demonstrates Conqueror's Haki by glaring at a bear, causing it to flee without physical contact.
keyMoments.significance: First display of Conqueror's Haki by an anime-original character.

keyMoments.title: Naguri's Past with Roger
keyMoments.description: Naguri reveals he was once a pirate captain who fought against Gol D. Roger and was easily defeated.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes his connection to the Pirate King and his wisdom about what it means to be a true captain.
keyMoments.quote: I once fought against the Pirate King, Gol D. Roger. My crew and I were no match for him.

abilities.description: Naguri possesses Conqueror's Haki (Supreme King Haki), which he demonstrated by intimidating a powerful bear with just a glare.

relationships.description: Naguri fought against Gol D. Roger as a pirate captain and was defeated. Roger spared his life and his crew, which changed Naguri's perspective.

evolutionMoments.description: Naguri reveals his past battle with Roger to the three brothers.

relationships.description: Naguri meets young Luffy and his brothers when he rescues them from a bear.

evolutionMoments.description: Naguri saves Luffy, Ace, and Sabo from a bear attack.

reveals.information: Was a pirate captain who fought and was defeated by Gol D. Roger
Anime-original character, not from the manga

name.japanese: ポートガス・D・エース

keyMoments.title: Ace's Parentage Revealed to Luffy
keyMoments.description: Sabo reveals to Luffy that Ace is the son of Gol D. Roger, the Pirate King.
keyMoments.significance: Anime-original scene showing how Luffy learned about Ace's true heritage.

keyMoments.title: Ace Rejects His Father
keyMoments.description: Ace becomes upset when Luffy asks about Roger and declares he doesn't want to be associated with his father, causing the brothers to temporarily break their bond.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals Ace's deep emotional pain and hatred toward his father, showing the psychological burden of being Roger's son.
keyMoments.quote: Don't ever mention that man to me again!

statusHistory.note: This is a flashback episode showing young Ace

relationships.description: Ace is the biological son of Gol D. Roger, though he harbors deep resentment toward his father.

evolutionMoments.description: Sabo reveals to Luffy that Ace is Roger's son, and Ace's hatred toward his father is shown.

relationships.description: Ace and Luffy are sworn brothers, though not related by blood. Tension arises when Luffy questions Ace about his father.

evolutionMoments.description: The brothers temporarily break their bond after Ace rejects questions about Roger.

relationships.description: Ace and Sabo are sworn brothers. Sabo knows about Ace's parentage.

evolutionMoments.description: Tension occurs when Sabo reveals Ace's heritage to Luffy.

reveals.information: Confirmed to Luffy that he is the son of Gol D. Roger
Deeply resents his father and doesn't want to be associated with him

keyMoments.title: Sabo Reveals Ace's Parentage
keyMoments.description: Sabo tells Luffy that Ace is the son of Gol D. Roger, the Pirate King.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that Sabo knows about Ace's heritage and is the one who tells Luffy (anime-original scene).
keyMoments.quote: Ace is the son of Gol D. Roger, the Pirate King.

keyMoments.title: Sabo's Father Seeks His Return
keyMoments.description: Unbeknownst to Sabo, his biological father Outlook III approaches Bluejam to arrange for Sabo's return to noble society.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up the conflict that will lead to Sabo's forced return and eventual tragedy.

statusHistory.note: This is a flashback episode showing young Sabo

relationships.description: Sabo is the son of the noble Outlook III, though he has run away from his family to live freely.

evolutionMoments.description: Outlook III plots with Bluejam to retrieve Sabo.

relationships.description: Sabo and Ace are sworn brothers. Sabo knows about Ace's true parentage.

evolutionMoments.description: Sabo reveals Ace's heritage to Luffy, causing tension.

relationships.description: Sabo and Luffy are sworn brothers.

evolutionMoments.description: Sabo tells Luffy about Ace's father.

reveals.information: Knows about Ace's parentage as Roger's son
His father is plotting to retrieve him using Bluejam

keyMoments.title: Luffy Learns About Ace's Father
keyMoments.description: Luffy learns from Sabo that Ace is the son of Gol D. Roger, the Pirate King.
keyMoments.significance: This anime-original scene shows when Luffy first learned about Ace's true parentage.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Questions Ace About Roger
keyMoments.description: After learning about Ace's parentage, Luffy innocently asks Ace about his father, not understanding why this would upset him.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy's innocent nature and inability to understand why being the Pirate King's son would be a burden.

statusHistory.note: This is a flashback episode showing young Luffy

relationships.description: Luffy and Ace are sworn brothers. Their bond is tested when Luffy learns about and questions Ace's father.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy learns Ace is Roger's son and questions him about it, causing tension.

relationships.description: Luffy and Sabo are sworn brothers. Sabo reveals important information about Ace to Luffy.

evolutionMoments.description: Sabo tells Luffy about Ace's parentage.

reveals.information: Learns that Ace is the son of Gol D. Roger

keyMoments.title: Outlook III Approaches Bluejam
keyMoments.description: Outlook III, Sabo's father, visits Bluejam and requests his help in retrieving Sabo to bring him back to noble society.
keyMoments.significance: Initiates the plot that will lead to Sabo's forced return and the eventual tragedy.

relationships.description: Outlook III is Sabo's biological father who wants to force him back into noble society.

evolutionMoments.description: Outlook III plots with Bluejam to retrieve his runaway son.

relationships.description: Outlook III uses Bluejam as a tool to retrieve his son from Gray Terminal.

evolutionMoments.description: Outlook III approaches Bluejam to arrange for Sabo's return.
